meanings.definition: A person, object, or place selected as the aim of an attack.
meanings.sent1: The bullseye on the archery board is the target.
meanings.sent2: Her target is to finish reading the book by the end of the week.
meanings.sent3: The cat thought the moving laser pointer was a target for her to catch.
meanings.sent4: His heart became the target of her affection.
meanings.sent5: The red balloon floated high in the sky, a perfect target for the children below.

meanings.definition: An objective or goal to be achieved.
meanings.sent1: The team set a target to score at least three goals in the match.
meanings.sent2: My target is to save enough money for a new bicycle.
meanings.sent3: Her target of eating all the cookies in one sitting was ambitious.
meanings.sent4: The target of becoming a doctor seemed unreachable at first.
meanings.sent5: The shiny trophy gleamed, a target for the competitors to strive for.

meanings.definition: A mark or point at which someone aims or shoots.
meanings.sent1: The bullseye is the target for the archer's arrow.
meanings.sent2: He focused on the small target in the distance.
meanings.sent3: The fly buzzing around the room became a target for the swatter.
meanings.sent4: Her eyes locked onto the target, ready to hit it dead center.
meanings.sent5: The distant mountain peak stood tall, a target for adventurous climbers.
